org.researchstack.backbone.answerformat

Class DateAnswerFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.researchstack.backbone.answerformat.AnswerFormat
      • org.researchstack.backbone.answerformat.DateAnswerFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BirthDateAnswerFormat

    public class DateAnswerFormat
extends AnswerFormat
    The DateAnswerFormat class represents the answer format for questions that require users to enter a date, or a date and time.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getStyle

        public AnswerFormat.DateAnswerStyle getStyle()
        Returns the style of date entry.
        Returns:
        the style of the date entry, Date or Date and Time

      • getDefaultDate

        public java.util.Date getDefaultDate()
        Returns the date to use as the default.

        The date is displayed in the user's time zone. When the value of this property is null, the current time is used as the default.

        Returns:
        the default date for the date picker presented to the user, or null

      • getMinimumDate

        public java.util.Date getMinimumDate()
        Returns the minimum allowed date.

        When the value of this property is null, there is no minimum.

        Returns:
        returns the minimum allowed date, or null

      • getMaximumDate

        public java.util.Date getMaximumDate()
        The maximum allowed date.

        When the value of this property is null, there is no maximum.

        Returns:
        returns the maximum allowed date, or null

        Description copied from class: AnswerFormat

        Returns:
